answers.answer: Where sis you get the test done? Was it an at home do it yourself test?

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Blood (RBC) in urine can be due to UTI, stones, bladder polyps, infections or cysts, prostatits, affection of kidney as in diabetes and hypertension.Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined as a confirmed diagnosis is not possible on net. You will need to rule out the causes one by one. Take care!
